useCase.name: Geofence Incursion
useCase.description: A Geofence establishes a virtual boundary around a geographical location. Most UAV provide support for establishing a geofence based on GPS coordinates and maximum altitude. Geofences can be established over rectangular, circular, or polygonic regions of a map. If a UAV breaches its geofence then a failsafe mechanism will activate causing the UAV to RTL or LAND in place. In many cases, the UAV supports a measured response with at least two trigger points associated with[APPROACHING_GEOFENCE] and [GEOFENCE_BREACH].

preconditions.precondition: A failsafe action has been pre-configured to activate RTL (Return to Launch) or land in place if the UAV breaches the geofence.
The UAV was launched from within the geofence.
The geofence has been correctly established around the UAV's intended flight path.

successEndConditions.condition: The UAV does not breach the geofence during its mission.

useCase.trigger: The UAV is armed and a geofence alert (either `[APPROACHING_GEOFENCE]` or `[GEOFENCE_BREACH]`) is triggered.

mainSequence.step: The runtime monitoring system detects that the UAV is approaching the geofence.
The runtime monitoring system raises an alert.
The current flight route is canceled.
The alert is displayed in the UI to notify the RPIC of the geofence warning.
Reroutes the UAV so that it avoids flying close to the geofence.
The RPIC intervenes and issues a new flight command to the UAV.
The failsafe mechanism is activated, based on the UAV's preconfiguration (e.g., RTL or land in place).
The RPIC maintains visual line of sight with the UAV until it completes RTL or lands.
If necessary, the UAV suspends the remainder of the mission or manually moves other UAVs out of the way of the returning UAV.

esteps.description: The RPIC decides that the current task cannot be continued by the UAV.
esteps.step: The RPIC decides that the UAV cannot complete its task and is relieved from the task.
The RPIC manually activates RTL for the UAV.
DroneResponse provides an option to assign another UAV with the task.
The RPIC assigns a new UAV with the task, and the mission continues.

esteps.description: No failsafe mechanism has been established onboard the UAV.
esteps.step: The runtime monitoring system raises a `[GEOFENCE_BREACH]` alert.
The RPIC immediately lands the UAV in place or manually activates RTL for the UAV.
